What is the purpose of these 20 logical statements?

These 20 logical statements aim to demonstrate various relationships between propositions P and M, showing their connections and implications, as well as identifying contradictions. They serve as a foundation for understanding basic logic and critical thinking.

No P is M  Some S is M  ∴ Some S is not P  11. No P is M  Some S is not M  ∴ Some S is not P  12. No M is P  Some S is not M  ∴ Some S is not P  13. No P is M  Some M is not S  ∴ Some S is not P  14. No P is M  No M is S  ∴ No S is P  15. No P is M  All M is S  ∴ No S is P  16. No P is M  All S is M  ∴ No S is P  17. All P is M  No S is M  ∴ No S is P  18. All M is P  No S is M  ∴ No S is P  19. Some M is P  Some M is not S  ∴ Some S is not P  20.
Introduction to Logic and Critical Thinking, by Matthew Van Cleave
